title: What is the difference between magic and psychic phenomena?
first_phrase: This text discusses the differences between magic and psychic phenomena, with a focus on eliminating attention-grabbing occurrences in magic, as opposed to seeking them out in psychic practices. The text also mentions the role of visualization and active, synchronized efforts in creating concrete magical effects. In the last 200 tokens, the author refutes the idea that internal experience in magic is inaccessible, as some critics suggest. Rather, it is a fundamental aspect of achieving the highest order of magic. The author emphasizes the importance of distinguishing between materialistic and magical paradigms.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the difference between high magic and other related phenomena lies in the continuous causal relationship. While some forms of magic may involve "spirit helpers," who act as intermediaries, it is not the highest order. Therefore, to engage in operational magic, it is necessary to elevate and actively engage in higher states of consciousness beyond ordinary awareness. Only then can one unlock the full potential of magic.
